title: Hermann Felsner
text:
Hermann Felsner (1 April 1889 – 6 February 1977) also known as "Ermanno Fellsner", was an <a href="Austria">Austria</a>n <a href="football%20%28soccer%29">football</a> player and manager from <a href="Vienna">Vienna</a>.
Club career.
As a player, he competed with the <a href="Wiener%20Sportclub">Wiener Sportclub</a>, before moving to <a href="Italy">Italy</a> to play for and manage many clubs.
Managerial career.
Although he managed several clubs, Hermann is most remembered for his time at <a href="Bologna%20F.C.%201909">Bologna</a> with whom he spent over a decade and led the club to four <a href="Serie%20A">Italian League</a> titles. In the club's entire history they have won seven "scudetti", making Felsner their most successful manager.
He also won the <a href="Coppa%20Italia">Coppa Italia</a> once, with <a href="Genoa%20C.F.C.">Genoa</a> in 1937.
